title: Hotel California
composer: Don Felder, Don Henley & Glenn Frey

musicalLanguage.description: An adaptation of the iconic guitar arpeggiation for piano. The song's verse uses a descending chord progression in B minor that creates its mysterious, hypnotic atmosphere. The piano arrangement preserves the flowing arpeggiated texture and the characteristic minor-key harmonic movement.
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: Bm to F# — the dark opening with the dominant pull
Bars 3-4: A to E — the relative major provides brief warmth
Bars 7-8: Em to F# — the haunting turnaround that pulls back to B minor
teachingGoals: Playing in B minor with two sharps (F#, C#)
Arpeggiated patterns adapted from guitar fingerpicking style
styleTips: Keep the arpeggiation even and hypnotic — this song casts a spell through repetition
The minor key should feel mysterious, not sad — there is beauty in the darkness
Slight rubato on chord changes enhances the dreamlike quality

measures.rightHand: F#4:e B4:e D5:e B4:e F#4:e B4:e D5:e B4:e
measures.teachingNote: B minor — the mysterious opening. Let the arpeggiation create a sense of place.

measures.rightHand: F#4:e A#4:e C#5:e A#4:e F#4:e A#4:e C#5:e A#4:e
measures.teachingNote: F# major — the dominant chord. A# is the leading tone that wants to resolve to B.

measures.rightHand: E4:e A4:e C#5:e A4:e E4:e A4:e C#5:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: A major — a moment of brightness in the minor landscape. Relative major warmth.

measures.rightHand: E4:e G#4:e B4:e G#4:e E4:e G#4:e B4:e G#4:e
measures.teachingNote: E major — the IV chord. G# gives it the major quality. The progression keeps descending.

measures.rightHand: D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: G major — the VI chord. We are far from home now, harmonically wandering.

measures.rightHand: D4:e F#4:e A4:e F#4:e D4:e F#4:e A4:e F#4:e
measures.teachingNote: D major — III chord. The brightness continues before the dark return.

measures.rightHand: E4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e E4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: E minor — the iv chord. Natural G replaces G#. The mood darkens for the return.
F# to Bm — the dominant resolves to tonic. The cycle is ready to repeat.
